info.title: How to use
info.body:
StructGen is a small desktop tool that turns a plain text description into a real folder and file tree inside your chosen root directory. Instead of creating folders by hand, you describe the structure as text ‚Äì the app generates it for you.

‚ö†Ô∏è General rules
- Everything is always created only inside the selected root directory.
- Attempts to go outside of the root directory are ignored (counted as "Skipped").
- If a folder or file already exists, it is not overwritten (counted as "Skipped").
- Empty lines in the structure definition are ignored.

üìÇ Structure format
- Each new line describes one location in the structure.
- General format: folder_path: file_list
- Left side before the colon ":" ‚Äì folder path (can be empty if files are created directly at the root level).
- Right side after the colon ‚Äì list of files, separated by commas.
- Folders in paths are separated with "/" (for example, src/components/ui).
- A line can contain only a folder (without a colon) ‚Äì then only the folder is created, without files.

üéØ Name rules (Windows)
- All folder and file names are checked against Windows naming rules.
- You cannot use the characters: < > : \" / \\ | ? * or control characters (0‚Äì31).
- You cannot use reserved names: CON, PRN, AUX, NUL, COM1‚ÄìCOM9, LPT1‚ÄìLPT9, etc.
- A name cannot end with a space or a dot.
- The names "." and ".." cannot be used as directory or file names.
- The maximum length for a single directory or file name is 255 characters.

‚ú® Examples

Example 1: Single file at root level
: README.md

Example 2: Folder only (no files)
src/components

Example 3: Folder with multiple files
src/components: Button.jsx, Card.jsx

Example 4: Multiple files at root level
: README.md, .gitignore, package.json

Example 5: Deep folder with files
src/components/ui/buttons: PrimaryButton.tsx, SecondaryButton.tsx

Example 6: More complex structure
src/components: Button.jsx, Card.jsx
src/utils: helpers.js, constants.js
public: index.html, favicon.ico
config: settings.json

errors.cannotWriteOutsideRoot: Cannot generate outside of selected root directory.

validation.invalidDirChar: A directory name contains Windows-invalid characters.
validation.invalidFileChar: A file name contains Windows-invalid characters.
validation.reservedDirName: A Windows-reserved name is used as a directory name (for example CON, PRN, NUL, COM1, LPT1, etc.).
validation.reservedFileName: A Windows-reserved name is used as a file name (for example CON, PRN, NUL, COM1, LPT1, etc.).
validation.trailingDotOrSpaceDir: A directory name cannot end with a space or a dot.
validation.trailingDotOrSpaceFile: A file name cannot end with a space or a dot.
validation.dotSegmentDirNotAllowed: The special segments "." and ".." cannot be used as directory names.
validation.dotSegmentFileNotAllowed: The special segments "." and ".." cannot be used as file names.
validation.segmentDirTooLong: A directory name is too long. Maximum allowed length is 255 characters.
validation.segmentFileTooLong: A file name is too long. Maximum allowed length is 255 characters.
validation.pathTooLongDir: The full directory path is too long and exceeds the Windows path length limit.
validation.pathTooLongFile: The full file path is too long and exceeds the Windows path length limit.
validation.generic: The structure definition contains invalid directory or file names.
